com.xilinx.rapidwright.bitstream

Class Block

  • Object
    • com.xilinx.rapidwright.bitstream.Block

  • public class Block
extends Object
    Represents a configuration block in the configuration array of the device. After frames, a block is the smallest configurable region of a device.
    Since:
    2020.2.1

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Block(Block orig)
      Copy constructor used as a convenience to duplicate a block.
      Block(int blockAddress)
      Creates a new config block initialized with the provided address

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Copies all frame data from the provided block into the corresponding frames of this block.

      int getBit(BitLocation bit, Tile tile)
      Gets the bit at the specified location for the provided tile

      Gets a configuration block height in terms of CLEs based on the provided series

      Gets the integer value block type of this block, see BlockType

      Gets the bottom tile that is covered by this configuration block

      Gets the series of this block based on the sub block type.

        Parameters:

        Since:

      • Block

        public Block(Block orig)
        Copy constructor used as a convenience to duplicate a block. This is useful duplicating configuration or when creating BRAM content blocks.
        Parameters:
        orig - The original block to copy and use as a template
        Since:
        2020.2.1

        Returns:

      • getFrames

        public Frame[] getFrames()
        Gets the array of frames corresponding to this block. Note, this requires that the subtype of the block be set on block beforehand.
        Returns:
        The array of frames corresponding to this block.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • getFrame

        public Frame getFrame(int index)
        Gets the frame within the block at the specified offset. Note, this requires that the subtype of the block be set on block beforehand.
        Parameters:
        index - Index within the block.
        Returns:
        The specified frame at the provided index.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • getFrameCount

        public int getFrameCount()
        Gets the number of frames in this configuration block. Note, this requires that the subtype of the block be set on block beforehand.
        Returns:
        Number of frames in this configuration block.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • setFrame

        public Frame setFrame(int index,
                      Frame frame)
        Sets (overwrites) the frame at the specified index within the block. Note, this requires that the subtype of the block be set on block beforehand.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the frame to set within the block
        frame - The new frame to set into the specified index.
        Returns:
        The old frame (or null if none) previously associated with the index.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • copyFrameData

        public boolean copyFrameData(Block block)
        Copies all frame data from the provided block into the corresponding frames of this block.
        Parameters:
        block - The source block from which to copy the data
        Returns:
        True if the operation succeeded, false otherwise.
        Since:
        2021.1.1

      • getBit

        public int getBit(BitLocation bit,
                  Tile tile)
        Gets the bit at the specified location for the provided tile
        Parameters:
        bit - The bit location
        tile - The reference tile
        Returns:
        The value of the bit at the specified location.
        Since:
        2023.1.3

      • updateBit

        public boolean updateBit(BitLocation bit,
                         Tile tile,
                         int value)
        For the given bit location, it updates the bit to value and returns the previous value.
        Parameters:
        bit - The bit location within the block
        value - Desired value to set in the bit location
        Returns:
        True if the bit was changed, false otherwise.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • updateBit

        public boolean updateBit(BitLocation bit,
                         Tile tile,
                         int value,
                         Block golden)
        For the given bit location, it updates the bit to value and returns the previous value.
        Parameters:
        bit - The bit location within the block
        value - Desired value to set in the bit location
        golden - A reference configuration block that is checked with the value to be set and prints an error message if there is a mismatch.
        Returns:
        True if the bit was changed, false otherwise.
        Since:
        2023.1.3
